events.originalText: A lone gunman fatally shot twelve people and injured three others at the headquarters of the Naval Sea Systems Command in Washington, D.C.
events.subtitle: Washington Navy Yard shooting
events.headline: Gunman kills 12 at Naval Sea Systems Command in Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: Seventeen Iraqi civilians were shot and killed by Academi guards in Baghdad.
events.subtitle: Nisour Square massacre
events.headline: Academi guards kill 17 Iraqi civilians in Baghdad

events.originalText: The British pound was forced out of the European Exchange Rate Mechanism on Black Wednesday, and suffered a major devaluation.
events.subtitle: Pound sterling
events.headline: British pound devalued after forced exit from European Exchange Rate Mechanism

events.originalText: Construction of the Northern Xinjiang railway (terminus pictured) was completed between Ürümqi South and Alashankou, linking the railway lines of China and Kazakhstan and adding a sizeable portion to the Eurasian Land Bridge.
events.subtitle: Northern Xinjiang railway
events.headline: Northern Xinjiang railway completed, linking China and Kazakhstan

events.originalText: A Lebanese militia under the direct command of Elie Hobeika carried out a massacre in the Palestinian refugee camp of Sabra and Shatila, killing at least 460 civilians.
events.subtitle: Elie Hobeika
events.headline: Lebanese militia massacre in Sabra and Shatila kills 460 civilians

events.originalText: Eight people escaped from East Germany to West Germany in a home-made hot air balloon.
events.subtitle: East Germany balloon escape
events.headline: Eight escape East Germany to West Germany in hot air balloon

events.originalText: Eight people escaped from East Germany to West Germany in a home-made hot air balloon.
events.subtitle: East Germany balloon escape
events.headline: Eight escape East Germany to West Germany in homemade balloon

events.originalText: The prototype of the Mikoyan MiG-31 (example pictured), one of the fastest combat jets in the world, made its maiden flight.
events.subtitle: Mikoyan MiG-31
events.headline: Mikoyan MiG-31 prototype makes maiden flight

events.originalText: Malaysia was formed as an independent nation from the Federation of Malaya, the Colony of Singapore, the Crown Colony of North Borneo, and the Crown Colony of Sarawak.
events.subtitle: Malaysia
events.headline: Malaysia formed as independent nation from multiple colonies

events.originalText: Typhoon Nancy, which possibly had the strongest winds ever measured in a tropical cyclone, made landfall in Muroto, Japan.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Nancy (1961)
events.headline: Typhoon Nancy with strongest winds hits Muroto, Japan

events.originalText: The U.S. National Hurricane Research Project sought to weaken Hurricane Esther by seeding it with silver iodide, leading to the establishment of Project Stormfury.
events.subtitle: National Hurricane Research Project
events.headline: Hurricane Esther weakened by Project Stormfury seeding

events.originalText: Second World War: Italian forces captured the town of Sidi Barrani, but their invasion of Egypt progressed no further.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Italian forces capture Sidi Barrani in Second World War

events.originalText: A bomb in a horse-drawn wagon exploded in front of 23 Wall Street in New York City, killing 38 people and injuring several hundred others.
events.subtitle: Wall Street bombing
events.headline: Bomb in horse-drawn wagon kills 38 in Wall Street explosion

events.originalText: Felix Mendelssohn completed the score of the Violin Concerto, his final concerto.
events.subtitle: Felix Mendelssohn
events.headline: Felix Mendelssohn completes Violin Concerto score

events.originalText: French physicist Augustin-Jean Fresnel, in a "note" read to the Academy of Sciences, reported a direct refraction experiment verifying David Brewster's hypothesis that photoelasticity (as we now call it) is stress-induced birefringence.
events.subtitle: Augustin-Jean Fresnel
events.headline: Augustin-Jean Fresnel reports direct refraction experiment

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: American colonists defeated British troops at the Battle of Harlem Heights (depicted) on the island of Manhattan.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: American colonists defeat British troops at Battle of Harlem Heights

events.originalText: At the Third Council of Constantinople, Pope Honorius I was posthumously excommunicated, with his support for monothelitism deemed to be heretical.
events.subtitle: Third Council of Constantinople
events.headline: Pope Honorius I posthumously excommunicated at Third Council of Constantinople
